## negateGuard() function

Creates a negated version of a type guard function.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function negateGuard<T extends Guard>(guard: T): NegateTypeGuard<T>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

guard


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The original type guard function to negate


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[NegateTypeGuard](./type-guard.negatetypeguard.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

A new guard function that negates the original guard's result

## Remarks

This function returns a new guard function that returns the opposite boolean result of the original guard function while maintaining proper type inference.

## Example


```ts
const isNumber = (value: unknown): value is number => typeof value === "number";
const isNotNumber = negateGuard(isNumber);

let value: number | undefined;

if (isNotNumber(value)) {
  value.toFixed(2); // error: Property 'toFixed' does not exist on type 'undefined'.
}
```
